11.title: Naruto

1113.title: More

1121.content:
Naruto Uzumaki walked down the streets of Konoha; arms laced behind his head. The spiky haired blond had just come back from a mission that took much longer than expected. As a result he had eaten barely anything the last few days and was starving!

“Ugh, I need some grub.” Naruto told himself as he touched his growling belly with one hand. His blue eyes glanced around for a place to eat. As he looked slightly behind him he noticed his favorite restaurant: Ramen Ichiraku. “Oh wow! I wasn’t paying attention and almost walked by Ichiraku!” Naruto mentally slapped himself for the near mistake and hurried toward the small shop; the smell of ramen pulling him toward it by his nose.

“Naruto! I thought I heard your stomach growling out there!” Teuchi greeted the young ninja as he appeared through the sliding door.

“Hehe.” Naruto chuckled as he blushed and scratched the hair on the back of his head. The orange ninja took a seat on one of the stools in front of him before speaking to the older man. “Well I’m starving! Get me something really filling, Teuchi!” Naruto barked in his usual hyperactive voice.

“Filling, eh?” the chef scratched his chin before smiling. “Well, that’d be most of your usuals, but I have something special for you today!” the restaurant owner turned away from Naruto and started preparing his favorite customer’s meal. Naruto blinked in curiosity; wondering what the man had planned. It was Ayame who spoke up moments later.

“A friend of father’s stopped by not long ago,” the girl stated to explain. “He gave us a very strange herb that’s apparently really good in ramen dishes.”

“That’s right!” Teuchi cut in as he stood over a boiling pot. “See, he’s also in the ramen business and he says this stuff’s been making him a fortune. It’s supposed to shrink your hunger right down!”

“Oooh…” Naruto watched as the older man prepared the ramen; his mouth already drooling and his ears only listening to half of what he was saying. He was just too famished to care where the delicious smelling ramen came from. After a few more minutes Teuchi carried over a steaming bowl of ramen and placed it in front of Naruto. The blond teen stared at the bowl of goodness with pure joy, though he didn’t recognize any difference compared to a normal bowl of pork ramen.

“Unfortunately, he only gave me enough for one bowl. You’ll have to decide whether I go ask him if he can sell me any of the stuff!”

“Well it smells the same…” Naruto muttered as he separated his chopsticks. “But it’s the taste that matters! Ikadakimasu!” The sixteen year-old genin immediately got to work scarfing down the ramen. Teuchi and Ayame both watched as their #1 customer consumed the contents of the bowl as if he inhaled the meats and noodles. It was a sight they were very used to and in just five minutes Naruto was already picking up the bowl and pouring the last of the broth down his throat. “Wow!” Naruto shouted as he slammed the bowl down upon the counter. He leaned back and gave his stomach a few pats. “That was great! Your friend was right, I’m really-“

Before he could finish, the young teenager disappeared in a cloud of white smoke. The two ramen chefs stared in disbelief as the smoke dissipated and revealed an empty stool where Naruto once sat.

“Not again…” the older chef said with a sigh as he recalled the last time Naruto had vanished like this in his restaurant. “Now how am I supposed to know if these herbs are worth buying?”

“Don’t worry, father. He’ll be back soon like last time.” Ayame replied as she gathered up Naruto’s bowl and chopsticks and brought them to the sink.

Unbeknownst to the father and daughter, Naruto was still very much among them this time. For you see, Teuchi’s “friend” was actually a bitter rival of his who harbored a deep hatred for him and his successful ramen shop. The rival had thus given Teuchi a dangerous herb that spelt doom for whoever consumed it. The bitter rival knew the tainted ramen would be prepared only for Teuchi’s best customer. Without their best customer, Ichiraku’s business would surely dwindle. Speaking of dwindle…

“W-What?” Naruto stuttered, blinking in confusion. He was still seated like he was seconds ago, but this time he was sitting on a strange green landscape. No longer was he looking into the faces of his two favorite ramen chefs; they had just vanished. “What’s going on?! Did you summon me away again, Fukasaku?!” Naruto shouted for the toad sage as he leaped to his feet, but he saw no sign of him…or anyone for that matter. “Where am I?!” Right after shouting this, the Leaf ninja went wide eyed and looked down at the green “land” below him. Slowly he bent down and touched it; the texture, while thicker, was much like the seats of Ichiraku! “N-No way…that’s impossible.” Naruto fell back onto his butt as his body shook in fright. He was STILL in Ichiraku…but his seat was now enormous! For it to be mistaken for a whole other landscape he had to be ant sized…maybe even smaller! “T-This has to be a dream…Teuchi wouldn’t give me a ramen that-“

Before Naruto could finish reassuring himself, he heard a loud sound behind him. The blue eyed, shrunken ninja turned his head around to see that someone had slid open the door to Ichiraku and stepped in. Naruto craned his neck and gaped as the titanic figure of a fellow ninja stood before him; his shadow surrounding him. Naruto recognized the titan’s clothes, face, and soon his voice. It was none other than…
1121.title: Shrinking Hunger

11213.content:
The young, mountainous figure that towered over Naruto was Konohamaru Sarutobi. Naruto couldn’t believe it was the same spiky haired genin he knew, however. The kid he knew was a whole head shorter than him, but this Konohamaru…he was bigger than anything Naruto thought could exist in this world!

“Hey, old man!” Konohamaru greeted; his youthful, child-like voice booming in Naruto’s eardrums. The young teenager closed the sliding door behind him and glanced over the empty row of stools in front of him. “No one else here today?”

“Well, you just missed Naruto.” Ayame replied to the young shinobi as she washed Naruto’s bowl in a sink; any remnants of that mysterious herb disappearing down the drain.

“Oh, boss just left?” Konohamaru asked as he took a step further into the small shop. The whole time Naruto was staring up at the looming kid; his neck craned back just to see his face. The miniscule blood stood there paralyzed, his mouth gaped open in shock and his fingers twitching. Unintelligible sounds came from the ramen lover’s throat; he was just unable to come up with a word to describe his situation. That one step brought the titanic Konohamaru so close to Naruto that the older male fell onto his butt trying to keep his eyes on the boy’s face. For a moment the fox boy’s vision was completely taken up by the pale green of Konohamaru’s jacket. A second later the young genin swung a leg over Naruto’s head and the tiny boy’s eyes grew even wider.

“FUCK!” Naruto cursed loudly as he looked up and saw nothing but the gray clad butt of his rival/apprentice. Konohamaru was about to sit down…right on top of him! Not a thought of escape crossed Naruto’s mind in the following milliseconds. He didn’t even move, for he knew there was no point. There was no way he could escape something so massive; not even if he was ten times faster. He would need a space/time jutsu, and even then he wouldn’t have enough time to use it. The only thing the gnat of a ninja could do was brace himself.

With a THUMP Konohamaru sat himself down on the stool; unknowingly pinning Naruto under his bigger body. Naruto was smashed between the seat and the giant kid’s butt; flat on his back and totally helpless.

“You could say that,” Teuchi replied to the young customer’s question. “So, what’ll it be?”

“Hmmm…” Konohamaru thought for a moment before answering. “I’ll have something with beans in it! I have an odd craving for some…” Konohamaru giggled as he licked his lips in anticipation.

“Beans, eh? Coming right up!” The Ichiraku owner nodded before starting on the order. Meanwhile, by some miracle, Naruto was not a pasty stain under Konohamaru’s rump (at least not yet…). The poor orange-clad ninja had been caught right between the giant boy’s butt cheeks and temporarily saved from a humiliating end. He still felt the heavy, unforgiving weight of the giant boy, however, as it slowly crushed him into the cushioned stool. The shrunken blond could barely move at all; in fact the only thing he could move was his mouth.

“Ugh…t-this can’t be happening!” Naruto exclaimed to himself as he tried his best to squirm underneath the sitting titan, but to no avail. “Konohamaru!! Get off me!!” The tiny ninja put all his strength into his struggling, but made no progress whatsoever. The giant brat was just too impossibly big; all Naruto could do was wait and hope he stood up soon.

And wait he did. It doesn’t take particularly long for Teuchi to prepare a bowl of ramen, but for Naruto the wait was unbearable. Every second was spent enduring the unbelievable weight of the giant above him. Within the first ten seconds Naruto’s face became covered in sweat due to the immense heat collecting underneath Konohamaru’s rump. The teenage shinobi laid there panting and trying to understand how a typical visit to Ichiraku has suddenly turned into a life or death situation. He was alive right now, but he couldn’t help imagining Konohamaru adjusting his position on the stool. These stools weren’t exactly Grade A after all and the simplest movement on Konohamaru’s part would spell instantaneous doom for him.

“Here you are, kiddo!” Teuchi called as he placed a steaming bowl of ramen in front of the scarf wearing teenager. A line of drool dripped down Konohamaru’s mouth as he gazed at the bean sauce topped noodle bowl.

“Mmmmm! Smells great!” the brown haired boy shouted as he grabbed his chopsticks, picked up the bowl, and dug in. He wasn’t as fast as Naruto, but after watching the older ninja eat ramen so much he tried his best to mimic his boss. While Konohamaru stuffed his boyish face he was unaware of Naruto’s suffering underneath him. The blond fox boy grunted as he felt his ribs start to creak from the pressure the giant of a boy was putting on him. It made him understand how fragile he was at this size; the mere twist of the butt or even a slide to the right would obliterate his tiny frame. The worst part, however, was that Naruto was consumed in complete darkness and silence. The massive ass flattening him blocked out any and all light and sound. He would never see his demise coming and that made him tremble in fear.
11213.title: A Big Pain in the Ass

112132.content:
“Ow ow! K-Konohamaru…!” The tiny Nine-Tails Jinjuriki hissed out in pain as he felt something crack. This was really happening: he was being crushed to death under his own friend! The godly boy had no clue either! “I-I can’t die…not like this!” the blond ninja spat as a trickle of blood dripped from his mouth. Things were quickly accelerating to a gruesome end; at this rate Naruto would burst like a grape no matter what Konohamaru did! The great Naruto, hero of the village, fated to end his ninja career under the ass of someone not even half as strong as him. As Naruto’s face was pinned onto its side and it became difficult to speak, the teenage genin started hyperventilating for a few seconds. However, the shrunken young man suddenly took a deep breath of the musky, hot air and calmed himself down. He couldn’t lose it now; he had to believe in the boy he shared a brotherly bond with! Konohamaru would never kill him; not even unintentionally!

“I’m not…dying here…” Naruto mumbled as he sported his signature smug smirk. “Because I’m Naruto Uzumaki, the-!”

*squish*

“Ahhhh, delicious!” shouted Konohamaru as he finished drinking the broth out of the bowl and slammed it down on the counter. His cute face blushed with delight as the young shinobi slid back on the stool and rubbed his belly happily.

“That was fast! Almost as fast as Naruto.” Teuchi spoke as he took the empty ramen bowl from Konohamaru. “You’re one of his rivals, right? Are you aiming to be my second best customer, kiddo?” The older man chuckled amusingly.

“Eh?” Konohamaru raised an eyebrow as he removed a bit of money from his wallet. “Well…Naruto’s going to be the Sixth Hokage one day and then he won’t have as much time to eat here. That’s when I’ll be your Number 1 customer, old man!” the spiky haired kid paid for his meal and gave the chef a thumbs up. He then hopped out of his seat and left the small restaurant; leaving Teuchi and his daughter to laugh. As Konohamaru walked down the crowded streets of the Leaf Village, none of his passersby noticed the dark, speck-sized smudge on his pants.
112132.title: Too Small for Bonds

choices: Gohan, Goten, and Trunks all shrink!
124.content: The only thing better than one shrunken guy is two! Or three! The first two groups of shrinkies is Gohan, Goten, and Trunks or Goku and Vegeta.
124.title: Multiple Characters

1241.content:
Gohan walked out of his room; checking to make sure his blue gi was on tight. The 17 year-old had promised his father he would spar with him today, but he had taken five minutes longer to change that usual. Not wanting to make his dad wait any longer Gohan hurried down the stairs. As he did he heard some giggling coming from the nearby living room. It sounded like Goten and Trunks and Gohan was going to just ignore them when suddenly there was a zap sound followed by a bright flash of green. A second later he heard Trunks’ voice shouting excitingly.

“Awesome, it worked!” cried Trunks, laughing with joy. “Now it’s my turn!” Gohan hurried toward the room to see what was going on, but before he got there another zap was heard and then another flash of green light. Gohan entered the living room a second later and discovered…nothing. The room was completely empty.

“What the heck?” the teenage half-Saiyan walked further into the room as he looked around with his black eyes. He definitely heard Goten and Trunks in here. After taking a few more steps away from the doorway, Gohan’s foot bumped into something and it slid away a couple feet. He glanced down and spotted what looked like a toy gun on the floor. Curious, Gohan picked it up and examined it in his hands. “That Goten…you’d think he’d of learned by now how angry mom gets when he leaves his toys around.” Gohan looked up from the gun and glanced around the room sternly. “Goten! I know you’re in here!” Gohan waited for his younger brother to come out of hiding, but there was no sign of him. Gohan went back to observing the toy gun and noticed the Capsule Corporation’s logo on it. “So it’s not a toy…don’t tell me it’s some kind of invisibility ray.” Gohan pointed the gun at himself and pulled the trigger as he said this. At the time he didn’t think much of the action, but it would prove to be one of his biggest mistakes. The gun lit up in his hands and with a zap it fired a green beam that hit Gohan square in his chest. Gohan was blinded by the resulting flash of light for only a second, but when his vision returned he noticed two things.

First, the gun was no longer in his hands, but on the floor in front of him. Second, it was HUGE. What had once looked like a toy gun now looked like a gigantic contraption before him. Gohan gaped up at the huge mechanism before spinning around and looking at the rest of the room. His living room now looked impossibly huge as if it was a whole other world. The cracks in the wooden floor now looked like he could squeeze through them and the furniture around him went up for miles. Gohan estimated he was only a centimeter in height!

“O-Okay…not an invisibility ray.” Gohan mumbled to himself.

“Yeah! Gohan joined us!” came the familiar, childish voice of Goten. Gohan looked to his right to see his brother and Trunks running toward him. Both were shrunken like him.

“Hey, watch where you’re stepping, Gohan!” Trunks shouted as they reached him. “You almost stepped on us a few times back there!”

“I did?” Gohan realized the two kids really were in the room and he simply hadn’t noticed. He was glad they were both unhurt, but… “Would one if you tell me what’s going on?”

“Can’t you figure it out?” Goten asked, smiling widely as he laced his arms behind his head. “Trunks brought a real-life shrink ray from home! Now we have all this space to play in! Isn’t it awesome?!”

“Awesome? Are you joking? Goten, this-” But the two demi-Saiyans didn’t seem to want to stick around since they both started to take off into the air while Gohan was still talking. The spiky haired teen thought fast and quickly grabbed one of the kids’ short legs in each hand before pulling them back down to the floor.

“What’s the big idea?!” Trunk’s asked as he glared at the older male.

“Listen, you two! You don’t seem to understand how dangerous this is! We’re the size of flies! What does mom do when she sees a fly?”

“S-She…swats it.” Goten answered with a gulp, but returned Gohan’s stern gaze with his own. “But mom isn’t home right now! She and Trunks’ mom went on some vacation together. The only one home is dad.”

“That doesn’t make this any less dangerous!” Gohan shouted back; getting frustrated. He couldn’t believe he had accidentally shrunk himself…but then again if he hadn’t he or someone else might of stepped on the two tiny kids. “Listen…we need to get back to normal. Lets try to find an undo switch on the shrink ray and-”

Before Gohan could finish he was interrupted by a loud BOOMing noise. It was quickly followed by another BOOM…then another…then another. The booms were getting closer and the floor started to tremble with each one. The three boys realized the sound was footsteps and they all fearfully turned their heads toward the living room’s entryway. A few BOOMs later and someone entered the living room. It was…
1241.title: Triple Trouble

choices: Gohan tells Goten and Trunks to stay put while he tries to get Goku's attention.
Gohan suggests they all try to get his attention.
12411.content:
The three Saiyan boys watched as the towering form of Gohan’s and Goten’s father, Goku, appeared at the doorway. The hulking man’s dark blue boots hit the floor with such force that the tiny trio thought he was stomping into the room; but actually he was simply walking normally. Goku stopped in front of the living room entrance and glanced around the empty room confused.

“Gohan? You in here?” Goku asked in a slightly raised voice. The Saiyan scratched the back of his head when he saw no signs of his son and heard no reply. “Could of sworn I heard him yelling…”

“Whoooaa…Goten, your dad is HUGE!” Trunks remarked, gazing up at the behemoth that had entered the room. Trunks was used to looking up at the adults, but never like this!

“Y-Yeah.” Goten replied, unable to say anything but an agreement to his friend. He was too busy staring up in awe at his titan-sized dad.

“H-He sure is a sight,” said Gohan, chuckling nervously as he craned his neck to look up at Goku’s clueless face. The older male then turned his attention to the two younger ones. “Why are you two so surprised? You saw me like this a few minutes ago. Wasn’t I-?’

Before Gohan could finish he was interrupted by the floor shaking under his feet and the loud booming noise of Goku’s footsteps returning. The giant man was on the move again; this time heading right for the shrunken gang!

“H-He’s c-coming t-this w-way!” Trunks shouted, stuttering due to the floor vibrating.

“M-Move!” Gohan ordered and the three boys scattered just as a shadow engulfed them. One of Goku’s blue boots hanged overhead and was about to come down on them without mercy. They flew as fast as they could and managed to escape the impact zone just as Goku stepped down, but little Goten was hit by the following wind pressure and sent flying back several feet. “Goten!” Gohan rushed to his little brother’s side and helped him up. “Are you okay?”

“I’m alright.” Goten replied while rubbing his forehead. “I can’t believe I was sent flying that easily…”

“It’s cause you’re so weak, Goten!” Trunks joked as he appeared at Goten’s side. The messy haired boy gave Trunks a glare in response.

“Anyway, we need to get dad’s attention before that happens again.” Gohan said before the two kids could start arguing. “Or worse, he finds the shrink ray and shrinks like us!”

“Hey, what’s this?” came Goku’s booming voice. Gohan looked back at his giant father to see him crouching down to pick up the shrink ray. The teenager cursed as Goku picked up the gun and examined it in his hand. “One of Goten’s toys? Heh, he sure is forgetful sometimes.” Goku chuckled before, to Gohan’s relief, pocketing the shrink ray.

“Aww man, it would have been funny if he shrunk himself too.” noted Trunks as he grinned. Gohan ignored him and kept his gazed fixed on his father. Now that he had the shrink ray they had no choice but to get his attention if they wanted to return to normal. However, Goku had already inadvertently showed how dangerous he was to be around and Gohan didn’t want to put the children in any unnecessary danger. Could he get his oblivious dad’s attention by himself, however?
12411.title: The BIGGEST Hero

124111.content:
“Alright, you two stay put while I go and get his attention.” Gohan told the two youngsters with his back turned to them.

“What?!” Trunks shouted. Gohan should of known better than assume he was going to follow his directions without complaint. “Why do we have to stay here and do nothing while you have all the fun?”

“I’m not going to have fun.” replied Gohan as he glared down at the lavender haired boy. “Did you forget how we were almost stepped on like bugs a minute ago? Was that fun?”

“N-No…” Trunks folded his arms across his chest and looked away. He didn’t want to admit it, but he really thought for a second they were going to be crushed back there…

“That’s what I thought. Unless you want to put yourself in more danger like that you’ll stay here.” The teenager than turned his attention to his brother. “The same goes for you, Goten.”

“Yes, Gohan.” Goten replied easily. He was disappointed that shrinking hadn’t been as fun as he thought it would be, but knew his brother was right about the danger. “Be careful, okay?”

“No sweat!” Gohan smiled as he stared to hover off the floor. “I’ve survived tones of tough battles; there’s no way I’m being done in by my own dad.” Gohan gave the duo a wave before zipping off into the air.

“Huh, I guess no one’s here.” Goku said to himself as he glanced around the room one last time. “I suppose Goten dragged him off on some adventure of something.” Goku laughed and started making his way toward the door. Gohan, not wanting his giant father to get to far, increased his speed so he could fly up to Goku’s face faster.

“Dad! Over here!” Gohan yelled while he zipped around the left side of Goku’s face. However, he was just too small for his voice to reach Goku’s ears. He continued to yell anyway, but the reaction h got wasn’t what he was hoping. Goku seemed to have noticed the tiny speck near his face since one of his big hands came up to swat it away. Gohan just narrowly managed to avoid the hand as it flew past him. “Hey, watch it! It’s me, dad! Gohan!” The tiny teen flew over Goku’s right side and repeated his attempts to get Goku’s help. Again, without even looking at the little pest, Goku swung his hand at it. This time Gohan wasn’t able to dodge completely and got struck by one of his dad’s knuckles. Goku barely felt anything, but Gohan was hit so hard that he was flung halfway across the room.

“Brother!” Goten yelled as he watched his dad swat his shrunken son away. Gohan grunted and managed to stop himself from crashing into anything. He winced in pain and rubbed his chest where the knuckle had hit him.

“Damn, that smarts…” Gohan muttered before glaring back at Goku with annoyance. Before Gohan reached the living room doorway, Gohan shot through the air at sonic speed and stopped right between his giant, hulking father and the exit. Goku once again noticed the “fly” which had stopped fight in front of his face. His huge eyes focused on Gohan and the tiny Saiyan believed he had finally succeeded. “Dad! You gotta help; the kids and I were shrunken by that device you found and-”

*SLAP*

Gohan was cut off when his titanic dad slammed his hands together on him. The two meaty hands came together with a loud SLAP and it appeared as if Gohan vanished between them. From the floor, Trunks’ and Goten’s mouths gaped in shock at this happening.

“You sure are a persistent fly,” Goku said to the bug between his palms. “I was trying to give you a chance, but now you leave me no choice. Chi-Chi told me to crush any bugs I find in the house and I really don’t want to disobey her, so…sorry about this.” Goku started to his press his hands together harder, since he could still feel a tiny bit of resistance between his palms. He was completely unaware that it was his son’s struggles as he was desperately pushing against the massive hands to avoid being totally sandwiched between them. The black haired teen had managed to throw up his hands just in the nick of time and was now using every ounce of his strength to keep his dad’s hands from closing completely. As blood vessels popped in his head and arms Gohan knew he couldn’t keep this up for very long. Goku was just far too strong at this size; the giant man was in a totally different league than him now. The only reason he hadn’t been crushed already was because Goku was only using less than one percent of his strength.

“Gotta…get out of here…before it’s too late!” Gohan told himself as he looked around for some way out. All he could see was the sweaty flesh of his dad’s palms all around him. The moment he let go to try and slip out would be the moment he’d die. Things looked bleak; his two muscular arms were already starting to strain. “S-Shit…shit…”

Back on the floor, Goten and Trunks couldn’t take their eyes off the scene before them. Things had taken a dramatic turn for the worse.

“G-Goten, at this rate your dad’s…going to mash Gohan into pulp!”

“W-We gotta save him, Trunks!” Goten turned to his older friend; a look of desperation and fear on his face. Tears were already starting to swell up in the boy’s eyes as well.

“I know, I know. Just let me think…” Trunks stared up at Goku; his mind racing. If he didn’t think of something in the next few seconds; Gohan was doomed!
124111.title: Gohan in Peril

choices: Trunks convinces Goten to help him.
1241112.content:
As Trunks’ mind raced to come up with some kind of rescue plan, Gohan was busy fighting a losing battle against his father’s hands. The teen was finding it harder and harder to breathe within the small, enclosed space between Goku’s palms. To make things worse the heat radiating off of Goku’s sweaty palms was intense; causing his shrunken son to sweat profoundly. Gohan grunted with pain as the space he was in shrank a little; his arms beginning to fail him. It was only a matter of time before Goku succeeded in crushing him into oblivion; Gohan had to do something before then! He had drained too much energy to go Super Saiyan; so there was only one hope left.

“D-Dad…s-stop!” Gohan cried as he closed his eyes and focused ki into the hands that were between him and death. In his fatigued state all Gohan could muster was enough ki for two small energy blasts. He prayed that it would be enough to make his dad separate his hands; if just for a second. That’s all he needed to escape. With a shout the demi-Saiyan unleashed two energy blasts from his palms into Goku’s massive ones. At his pathetic size all Gohan could hope for was giving his father a tiny sting; but maybe that would be enough…

“What was that?” Goku question as he raised an eyebrow. “You biting me? You’ve got a pretty strong bite too; I actually felt that. Still…with a bite that strong you’re way too dangerous to remain in this house. Sorry, but it’s time to end this.” With that said Goku closed his eyes and was silent for a moment. The air around Goku started to twist and grow hotter. Gohan felt it more than anyone; his pupils dilated as realized Goku’s power level was rising dramatically. Fear overtook him at this point and he screamed for his dad to stop. Not able to hear his miniscule son’s pleas; Goku’s eyes shot open and he released a booming shout. The man’s black hair lit up gold and an aura of super hot ki engulfed his form. The unbelievable heat consumed Gohan; but thankfully the young man was only exposed to it for a millisecond. With Goku’s strength multiplying, Gohan didn’t stand a chance. His arms snapped like twigs and in the same moment his body was completely and utterly smashed between Goku’s hands; a visible distortion rippling the space around the hands as they met. “You were a worthy opponent, bug.” stated Goku as he powered down and rubbed his palms together. What remained of the once all powerful Gohan was smeared across his dad’s muscular hands and became nothing more than a couple tiny red spots. Goku then took his hands and wiped them off on his gi; erasing any evidence of his son from existence. The giant man then continued out of the room; leaving behind two stunned and speechless kids.

“O-O-Overkill…” was all Trunks could say after witnessing that. Next to him Goten fell to his knees while his watery eyes stared at his massive father until he disappeared from view. Tears rolled down his cheeks and the younger boy began bawling.

“Gohaaaan!!!” he cried. “T-This can’t be happening!”

“Hey, Goten!” Trunks knelt down and placed his hands on his friend’s shoulders. “You can’t break down on me now! We’ve gotta get that shrink ray from your dad and return to normal!”

“I-It’s all our fault, Trunks! We never should of shrunk ourselves! G-Gohan told us how dangerous it was, b-but we weren’t listening! N-Now he’s…now he’s…” Goten covered his eyes with his hands and continued to sob. Trunks bit his lip; this really sucked. All he wanted was to have fun and now Gohan was dead and Goten was drowning in despair. He knew they needed to get that shrink ray back…but Goten wasn’t going anywhere in this state. Was there any way to snap Goten out of it? Or would he have to leave him behind and try to get the shrink ray alone?
1241112.title: Too Much of a Bad Thing

131.content:
Soul Eater Evans was laying down on his bed; sunlight filtering in through the window right on his face. With an annoyed groan Soul woke up and his red eyes fluttered open. He glanced over at the digital clock next to his bed and sighed.

“Man, why does Maka have to be so protective?” Soul said to himself as he sat up in his bed and looked down at himself. Yesterday the two of them had been ambushed by a couple witches on their way back from a mission. It was pretty hairy, but both of them escaped unscathed.

Well…almost unscathed.

Soul lifted up his yellow and black jacket and glared at the black symbol decorating his belly. One of the witches had hit him with a spell while in scythe form. While relatively unharmed, it had left him with his odd fly-shaped mark. The moment they got back to Death City Maka had insisted that Soul stay at home while she searched for any info on the spell at Shibusen.

“Knowing her she’ll be in that library all day.” Soul muttered to himself as he let himself fall back on the bed with his arms laced behind his head (which he turned away from the window). “If it didn’t do anything then it isn’t going to do anything now.” Soul told himself before going back to sleep a minute later.

Ten minutes passed before Soul was awoken once again. This time it wasn’t because of the sunlight, however, but because of the terrible pain coming from his stomach. Soul shot up and hugged his gut with both arms while his face twisted with pain. It felt like he had suddenly been decked in the stomach by Black Star…using BOTH his fists!

“The hell is this?” Soul grunted as he slowly got out of bed and wobbled out of his bedroom. He made his way toward the bathroom, but something told him he wasn’t going to make it that far. His vision was getting blurry and it was difficult to walk straight. Soul smacked into the right wall and slid to his knees. The world seemed to melt around him before he lost consciousness and collapsed in the middle of the hallway.

Soul didn’t know how much time had passed before he woke up. As he sat up he held his head and hissed in pain.

“Ugh…if this is what a hangover feels like I’m never drinking.” Soul joked to himself as he shook the dizziness away and made his way to the bathroom.

…at least he would of if the sight before he hadn’t frozen him in his tracks. Soul’s jaw dropped as he gazed up at the MASSIVE hallway he was in. The doors on either side of him stretched up like skyscrapers; it was unbelievable. Next to him were a couple misplaced books and magazines, but Soul mistook them for buildings! This wasn’t his apartment! This was the apartment…of a giant!

“W-Where the hell am I?” Soul took a few steps backwards. His foot got caught in something and he fell back with a yelp; slamming his back against the hard wooden floor. Soul winced and rubbed his back while he looked down at his foot. His shoe had gotten caught in a hole…and then it dawned on Soul. He knew this hole…it was one of many that dotted his apartment. They were common in such a cheap place like his. But this was impossible; he couldn’t fit his fingernail through those holes yet it looked like he could squeeze both his legs through this one! “What the hell is going on?” Soul stood up again and took a minute to clear his head. He thought for a moment before lifting his jacket up and noting that the weird mark was gone. “Damn it! That thing must if shrunk me!” Soul cursed as he let his jacket fall back into place before returning his gaze to the giant apartment…HIS giant apartment. “Maka was right. If this had happened out in public…” Soul shuddered at the thought. It was a good thing he was alone. He just had to find a safe place before-

“Hey, anyone home?” came another voice out of the blue. Soul’s eyes widened as he heard a door open and close, followed by the sound of someone walking around the apartment. Their footsteps sounded like explosions in the distance to the minuscule Soul. Someone had just invited themselves into his home…and judging by their voice Soul knew exactly who it was!
131.title: The Bug Curse

choices: Maka Comes in and Digustedly Kicks Black Star Out
Kid Comes In and Is Horrified By Star's Disgusting Feet's Lack of Symmetry
Tsubaki Politely Knocks To See if Black Star is There
1311.content:
BOOM!

BOOM!

BOOM!

Soul looked up in absolute awe to see his now enormous blue haired best friend: Black Star! Black Star now really look like the god he always said he would surpass. Judging by how Soul hardly came up to the toe end of Star's enormous shoe in front of him, he must've been quite small indeed!

"Whoa, Black Star would get such a power trip from this if he saw himself right now." The stunned Soul said as his friend's feet soared over his head as B*S leapt onto the couch, butt first.

The groaning of the couch springs as soon as his muscular ass made contact with the cushion was like nails on a chalkboard to tiny Soul. He grit his teeth and cried out as he covered his ears. "Dammit Black Star! Sigh....okay, I need to get his attention....lets hope he doesn't get too full of himself once he sees me."

Preparing himself to rush at B*S's shoe and begin the long trek up his best friend's leg, Soul jogged in place and did some warmup exercises. When he was finally ready, he rushed the black and silver shoe only to have it lifted up right before him, he ran right under the couch skidding to a stop before he got too far.

Peeking out from underneath it, he saw Black Star removing his shoes, obviously making himself quite at home. The shoes were removed, one kicked across the room, the other falling right towards him!

"AH!!!" Soul tried to get away, but he was just in the wrong spot at the wrong time, luckily.....or unluckily, for him, the shoe landed in a way that the opening was right on top of him, he lurched forward and found himself in the upside down toe section of the shoe that Sta wore everyday without socks. "Oh man! This is so gross, it reeks in here!"

He heard Black Star sighing in comfort above him as he placed his big sweating feet on the coffee table. "Maka would kill him if she knew what he was doing right now."

Just then....
1311.title: It was Black Star.

choices: Black Star heads back to his own apartment.
Black Star takes a walk somewhere.
13111.content:
Not three seconds after Soul uttered these words he heard the sound of the door opening and closing again. Then the voice of his meister caught his attention.

“Soul! I’m back!” Maka called as she walked into the living room holding a folder filled with papers in his hand. She promptly froze in place when her eyes fell upon Black Star sitting on the couch; bare feet resting on the coffee table. The blue haired assassin had his eyes closed and arms resting behind his head. He had heard Maka come in, but kept his eyes closed in a relaxed state. Maka’s face slowly twisted with disgust and anger as she squeezed the folder in her hand. “Black Star! What the hell are you doing?!”

“Yo.” Black Star replied simply, giving Maka a casual wave. “What’s up?”

“What’s up? WHAT’S UP?!” Maka stomped over to Black Star, rolling up the folder in her hands and using it to whack one of the teen’s feet hard. Black Star hissed in pain as he took his feet off the coffee table and rubbed the one that had been whacked.

“What’s your problem?!” Black Star shouted, glaring at the pissed off girl.

“What are you doing here?! Soul needs to rest and I need to go over these documents. The last thing we need is for your DISGUSTING feet to stink up the place. Get out!”

“Soul’s here?” Black Star asked, surprised. “I thought no one else was here; I’ll go say hi!” Black Star got to his feet, but before he could head towards Soul’s room Maka picked up one of his black shoes (the one Soul wasn’t in) and tossed it at the boy’s face. Black Star caught it with one hand as it came within inches of his nose.

“No you won’t! You’re gonna put your filthy shoes on and get your ass out of here! NOW!”

“Okay, okay! Crazy bitch…” Black Star cursed under his breath as he slipped on the shoe in his hands. He then reached down and turned the upside-down shoe right side up. The tiny Soul screamed as his entire world shifted upside-down. He fell from the top of the toe section to the bottom; groaning as he picked himself up. He noticed light was flooding into the shoe and turned around to watch as the light was quickly blocked by something else. Soul’s eyes dilated and he gaped as he watched Black Star’s huge, sweating foot slip into the shoe and rush toward him.

“N-No! Black Star, stop!” Soul cried, but Black Star had no idea there was anything in his shoe. Soul tried to run, but the foot was just too huge and where would he go? Before he could take a second step the foot hit him and forced him deeper into the shoe. Soul pulled the shoe on nice and tight before making his way to the door. Apparently he wasn’t going fast enough since Maka angrily pushed him out the rest of the way. When Black Star turned around to face her she slammed the door in his face. The athletic meister stood there staring at the door for a moment; grinding his teeth together. That girl really got on his nerves sometimes, but he knew Soul would get angry at him of he ever retaliated.

“Whatever.” Black Star muttered as he laced his muscled arms behind his head and went back the way he came. Meanwhile, inside his right shoe, Soul was still very much alive, but trying to figure out where he was. The albino teen was laying on his stomach; his face pressed against the hot, moist material of Black Star’s insole. On either side of him was a wall of flesh that occasionally shifted. All a round him he could hear and feel booms and with each boom came a jolt of pain in his legs. The ant sized weapon tried to move, but was unable to move an inch. He looked behind him and saw his entire lower half was hidden under Black Star’s foot. It took Soul a few minutes to fully understand his position; mainly because the fumes and constant motion were making him ill. He must be between two of Black Star’s toes with half of him pinned under the foot itself. Each time the titan of a boy took a step his godly weight would come down on Soul’s legs. Luckily the skin between the toes was soft or else Soul’s legs would be paste by now.

“This is so uncool.” Soul complained, unsticking his face from the bottom of the shoe with a little effort.
He tried to get his legs free, but it was useless. He would have better luck just pulling them off. There was nothing the shrunken teenager could do but lay there within the hot, smelly confines of Black Star’s shoe until a chance of getting out presented itself.

“I wonder why Soul’s resting…” Black Star wondered to himself as he looked up at the blue sky. “This sucks; I wanted to hang out with him today! Now what am I gonna do…?” Black Star made his way down the sidewalk; unaware that Soul and he were already “hanging out” together.
13111.title: Maka Comes in and Digustedly Kicks Black Star Out

choices: the pool of soda formed on Black Star’s belly.
131111.content:
“Tsk! There’s nothing to do here, this is boring. I should go home and do some exercise. Or maybe Tsubaki has bought some food and she’s cooking something delicious. That’d be great. Tsubaki knows how to nourish the person who will become superior to Gods.” The young Meister was talking alone, drooling, as he continues walking down the sidewalk.

From inside his shoe, the white haired weapon could hear muffled sentences with his friend’s intonation without know what he was planning. Each step only made him moan with pain as waves of stench invaded his nose when a bit of air circulated each time Black Star lifted his humongous foot. “Damn! This is not cool crying for help, but this is starting to be even more disgusting! Agh!” Soul felt the pressure of the giant’s whole body against his body again as the perspiration on Black’s feet rose due to the heat and the lack of ventilation. Strands of liquid sweat ran over his face and mixed with his own. The smell in there was unbearable; it was almost impossible to breathe. He only wished to reach some place that made his best friend stop walking to avoid, at least, the pain of the pressure crushing his minuscule body.

After running upstairs to reach his house and making Soul endure the worst seconds in his whole life due to the strength used in each step, Black Star reached the door of his house. Under him, he found the doormat, and recalling what Maka said about his feet, he brushed his feet against it. Then, he knocked the door which seemed to be opened. “Whops! It seems I forgot to close the door when I left the house, hehe.” Inside his shoe, the tiny was wriggling in pain under the meaty surface. The wriggle made the blue haired guy think that his toes were itching, so suddenly he started to scrub the sole of his shoe against the doormat trying to get some relief. This made the tiny bug trapped between the foot and the sole of the shoe to scream in pain, feeling the friction of the whole mass of muscle over him falling on every part of his hurt body. After doing this, the young boy smiled and entered the house shouting, “I’m back!!” He walked a little around the place trying to see if Tsubaki was home, but did not discover any clue of her presence. “Now that Tsubaki isn’t around I can do whatever I want!” And saying this, he ran towards the fridge; opening it and finding that it was full of food… and a note. The energetic kid grabbed it and read it loud: “Don’t touch the food. Tsubaki. Smiling face…” The ninja meister crumpled the little note with his hand and threw it against the floor. He then stomped it violently, luckily for Soul, with the foot without his friend, letting him hear loud booming hits against the floor. “Damn Tsubaki! How dare to do this to me! To the guy who shines even more than the sun! Not fair!” Then the guy calmed down and saw some cans of what looked like soda. “Hey! She didn’t say anything about these cans.” The guy said grabbing one and lifting it into the sky and laughed loud and naughtily. Then, without taking care to close the door of the fridge, he ran towards the sofa and jumped over it. He sat on it in with his arms and legs extended. “Let’s have a relaxing time! You agree, right?” Black said to the can.

Soul was waiting for an opportunity like this for what seemed like hours to him. Finally, his so active friend stopped for a little while and his world seemed to rise again. In fact, after spending the whole time lying down, now he was in a vertical position. He could see as his friend wriggled his toes inside the shoe and stretched them. That was a good sign. It looked like he was going to remove his shoe.

On the sofa, Black Star stretched his whole body and suddenly started to remove his sleeveless shirt; making him bare-chested. He passed the cold can over his pectorals and abdominals feeling a chilling sensation along his whole body. The guy was looking really relaxed as he started to remove one of his shoes, the one containing his little friend, using his other foot as he started to open the can. When he felt his shoe wasn’t encasing his foot he moved his leg violently and sent the shoe flying. He then opened the can; spilling some soda over his belly accidentally. He forgot he had to wait a bit because he ran toward the sofa shaking the can.

Soul smelled as the odor inside the shoe started to mix with Black’s house smell. Some light was filtering into the footwear and suddenly an intense shaking sent his foul smelling prison and himself spiraling across the room. Everything started to spin around, but the force of gravity caused him to slip from the shoe before it crashed somewhere. He was falling until he reached…
131111.title: Back to home.

choices: Black Star finds something that makes him laugh and Soul loses his balance again
Black Star wipes the pool of soda off his belly with his hand and licks it up
1311111.content:
Soul squeezed his eyes shut as he fell through the air. He had no clue where he was going, but knew he was most likely going to end up a stain on Black Star’s floor. The young Weapon braced himself for the inevitable impact, when suddenly…*SPLASH*

Instead of going splat on some hard surface, Soul had landed in a pool of some kind of cold liquid. It tickled his nose and prickled his skin; upon sitting up in the waist-deep pool Soul confusingly rubbed the back of his head and sniffed his soaked arm.

“What the hell?” Soul pondered as he winced at the pain in the back of his head. The landing hadn’t exactly been soft, but this odd brownish liquid had probably saved him. It was only upon licking his fingers that Soul realized what he was sitting in. “This is…soda? That kind Black Star likes. Coke or Pepsi or something.” Soul wondered what a pool of the stuff was doing here when suddenly the “ground” he was sitting on started to shake. The itty-bitty teen heard some humming behind him and looked behind him to get the sight of his life. Past a landscape of youthful muscles was Black Star’s face; smiling as he sipped from a can of soda. His adam’s apple bobbed as he chugged the soda before gasping for breath and belching loudly.

“Ahh, this is the life~” the blue haired Meister exclaimed as he rubbed his bare back against the sofa cushion; an action that once again made the “ground” tremble.

“Oh shit, not cool!” Soul muttered, eyes wide as he realized he was sitting on top of his giant friend. Judging by the view he had of the rest of his friend’s massive torso, Soul estimated he was on his belly. He also just noticed the gaping hole behind him; Black Star’s navel. “That oaf must of spilt soda on himself and didn’t bother to clean it up.” Soul grumbled to himself and stood up; his shoes still submerged in the pool of soda. What was nothing but an insignificant puddle of soda to Black Star was like a large kiddie pool to Soul.

“Let’s see what’s on!” Black Star shouted to himself before snatching up the TV remote on the floor nearby and powering on the television. Soul watched as the shirtless giant aimlessly clicked through the channels’ occasionally sipping from the soda can in his hand.

“Well, this isn’t too bad…” Soul mumbled to himself as he glanced around. “Doesn’t look like he’ll move for awhile, so it gives me some time to get up there and get him to notice me. “ The albino Weapon started to move, but upon taking the third step he suddenly slipped and lost his balance for a moment. He quickly regained his composure and sighed. “Damn, this soda’s really made his abs slippery. If I’m not careful I’ll slip and slide right into…that.” Soul’s crimson eyes glanced at the wide bellybutton behind him. “If I fall in there I might not get out!” The teenage Shibusen student took a moment to calm himself before slowly making his way through the pool of chilly soda. Unfortunately, upon taking that third step again…
1311111.title: Safe(?) Landing

choices: Wait for Black Star to finish watching TV, while the soda slowly dries
Try to climb out of the bellybutton despite the frequent ‘belly rumbling’
13111111.content:
Black Star finally found a channel worth watching and, suddenly, the ‘ground’ below Soul started rumbling. His foot slipped on the puddle of soda and he fell backwards, his butt landing with a splotch in the brown liquid, soaking his pants.

“Whahahaha!!”

Black Star’s laughing voice was booming from above, laughing at the TV. Whatever that blue-haired loudmouth was watching, it was apparently very funny. However, Soul was not all amused by the current situation right now.
He felt himself slipping further down, and flailed his arms in a desperate attempt to catch hold of something… anything. His fingers brushed against one of the downy hairs on Black Star’s stomach, and he managed to grab hold of it. He skid over on his stomach and reached out for another hair with his other hand. He kept holding on, his stomach to Black Star’s and his clothes getting soaked by the sugary soda, as the tremors slowly subsided.

Heaving a sigh of relief, Soul looked back. He had slid down precariously close to the wide bellybutton, and a thin trail of soda was slowly flowing down towards it. Just when he was about to pull himself up again and get out of this awkward position, Black Star started laughing again, even louder, and his whole belly shook along with it.
Soul tightened his grip on the hairs as he tried to withstand the tremors of the stomach and avoid slipping down any further. His arms felt like they were at their limit, but he gritted his teeth as he kept struggling to stay where he was.

However, Black Star was obviously enjoying the show – some kind of stand-up comedy thing by the sound of it, although Black Star’s boisterous laughing drowned out most of the sound coming from the TV. In fact, he was enjoying the show so much that he started slapping the side of his stomach in delight.

It was at this time that Soul really started hating his friend’s animated, overexcited personality, for the vibrations being caused by Black Star’s hand slapping the side of his stomach – which sounded much like a series of bombardments – made him bounce up in the air and loose his grip on Black Star’s stomach hairs.

With another wet ‘splotch’ he fell back down into the puddle and bounced along. He tried to get some kind of hold anywhere, but his hands were so thoroughly covered with the fizzy brown liquid that he couldn’t get a grip. And, much to his dismay, he started sliding downwards – flailing his limbs – along the trail of soda into Black Star’s bellybutton.
He fell face forward into the navel, and rubbed his head, trying to stand up.

“Oh, crap. Not cool, not cool.”
He looked up at his surroundings, and it was like he had fallen down a deep pit. Some soda was seeping in from above, and although the navel was only about two or three times his height, with his soda-covered state and the slick feel of Black Star’s skin, he doubted he could scale up.

“Arghh… what’s that smell!?”
A sharp, pungent smell invaded his senses, and when he looked around Soul realized that, from all the gathered lint and dirt he could see, Black Star hadn’t cleaned his bellybutton in a long time. It wasn’t as bad as being under his feet had been, but being gathered here and unable to get out – much like the bellybutton lint surrounding him – made him feel all the more insignificant.
As the soda trickled down and pooled around him, and every now and then his world seemed to shake as Black Star laughed at another joke, Soul pondered on what to do.
13111111.title: Stomach Tremors

choices: ...the giant awake after watching a tiny bug crawl out of his bellybutton.
131111111.content:
Soul thought about attempting an immediate escape from this damp pit, but he quickly dismissed the idea when another rumbling laugh from Black Star sent him off his feet and face first into a mound of wet navel lint. The albino weapon gagged as he picked himself up and wiped the black filth from his face.

“Ick, not cool!” Soul exclaimed as he wiped his face with his hands and sat down with a slight “splash”. The small pool of soda on the giant’s stomach was continuing to drip into the navel; forming another pool at the bottom that mixed with he giant’s sweat and bellybutton lint. It was completely repulsive, but Soul had no choice but to sit in it. Trying to climb out now would probably just end in another face full of smelly lint. “No choice…guess I just have to wait for it to dry.” Soul sighed as he leaned against the slick flesh behind him and tried to ignore the obnoxious laughing coming from outside and the musky smell coming from all around him. Instead he focused on the sounds that were coming from all around him; behind Black Star’s strong stomach muscles were his noisy innards that somehow seemed to soothe Soul. Even as the shrunken pianist sweated in his friend’s body heat and droplets of soda dampened his white hair, he was somehow able to close him crimson eyes and drift off into sleep. Perhaps the fatigue he had collected from almost getting crushed several times in one day had something to do with it…

Soul didn’t know how long he slept. It could have been an hour, two hours, or just thirty minutes. When his eyes fluttered open, it wasn’t to the sound of Black Star’s booming laughter, but to another obnoxious sound that he was capable of making: snoring. The television was still blasting nearby, but Soul could clearly hear the sound of his ninja friend’s snoring mixed in with it.

“That muscle head must of fell asleep. He can sure be lazy sometimes…” Soul mumbled to himself as he stood up. As his shoes set down upon the soft bottom of the titan’s bellybutton, the shrunken teen noticed the soda was gone. The smell still lingered in the air and on his clothes, but the liquid had been completely absorbed by the giant’s skin. “Alright, now’s my chance!” Soul craned his neck and looked up through the hole above him. He wanted to get out before the giant started moving again, so he quickly grabbed onto one of the fleshy walls and started climbing. Black Star’s bellybutton wasn’t very deep, so it didn’t take long before he was pulling himself over the edge and back onto his giant buddy’s abs. The unlucky Weapon laid down on the giant Meister’s stomach and breathed in the (relatively) fresh air.

“I’m so glad to be out of there…” Soul said to himself between breaths. While still laying down on his back, Soul looked behind him toward Black Star’s upside-down face and saw…
131111111.title: A Short Rest

choices: lord death himself (to go wih the original series, he cant go outside of the DWM
1353.title: more....

choices: Natsu attacks Romeo's feet in his anger.
Natsu tries to stay calm and come up with a plan.
141.content:
It was your typical, noisy day at the Fairy Tail guild house. Lunch was being served and Natsu Dragneel was busy chowing down on some beef and mashed potatoes. Seated around him were his friends whom he chatted with; usually with a mouthful of grub. All of a sudden…

“Hey, big bro!” came a youthful, loud voice. Natsu turned his head just as a young, black haired boy leaped onto the table he was sitting at. The youngster of Macao , Romeo Conbolt, stood atop the wooden table with his hands on his hips and eyes focused down on Natsu. “Big bro; fight me!” Romeo exclaimed, pointing a finger at the rosy haired Dragon Slayer. The demand shocked almost everyone in the guild; even Natsu just blinked at him. In seconds, however, that blank stare turned into a grin.

“Alright!” Natsu replied, putting on his usual “I’m getting fired up!” look.

“Hey, Natsu-!” Lucy tried to stop him, but Natsu had already gotten out of his seat. A similar grin decorated Romeo’s face as he leaped down from the table and faced the older teen. Natsu just folded his arms over his muscular chest and watched to see what the boy would do.

“I’m gonna give it my all, big bro, so watch out!” Romeo announced before wrapping his right fist in a bright, purple flame. The young Fairy Tail mage cried out as he charged at Natsu; rearing the fist back and plunging it right into Natsu’s stomach. Romeo’s smile twitched as he tried to ignore the pain in his knuckles, but the smile went away completely when he heard the older fire mage laugh above him.

“Awesome! I won’t hold back either!” Natsu replied, unfazed by Romeo’s punch. The smaller male could only watch frighteningly as Natsu wrapped his own fist in a blazing red flame.

A second later, Romeo was sent hurtling into another (thankfully empty) table. The wooden table snapped in half by the impact; leaving Romeo twitching on the broken planks. His cheek was swollen and some blood trickled down his chin. Natsu shouted in victory as he pumped his fist into the air. It was short lived, however, as a certain red haired woman grabbed him by the ear.

“What do you think you’re doing, Natsu?!” Erza asked, tugging on the pink haired teen’s ear. “Romeo’s just a kid; don’t use your full strength!”

“Ow ow ow ow! What’s the problem, Erza?! He was the one who asked for a fight, plus Gildarts never went easy on me when I was his age!”

“Still…” the female knight grumbled, knowing Natsu was right. “Alright then, what about the table?!”

“T-The table?” Natsu looked at the broken piece of furniture before chuckling nervously. “Ah…well…you see…” Before Natsu could come up with an excuse he was already being dragged away by Erza; screaming the entire time.

“Romeo, are you okay?!” came Macao’s voice as the older, blue haired man ran over to his son. Romeo grunted as he sat up and rubbed his puffy, slightly burnt cheek. It was a miracle he hadn’t lost any teeth.

“Yeah, I’m fine, dad.” replied the black haired teen as he wiped away the blood that was coming from his lip. “Big bro is really strong, but one day I’ll definitely pay him back for that. Tenfold!" Macao stared at his son for a moment before smiling at him.

“You know, I don’t appreciate someone slugging my son like that.” Macao stated as he helped Romeo to his feet. “What do you say we pay him back now instead of later?” Macro smirked while Romeo was left staring at his father and wondering what his plan was…

~~~~~

Awhile later, Natsu was alone in the Fairy Tail storage room. And busy stacking what seemed like an endless amount of wooden crates and boxes. The Salamander groaned to himself as he realized how much more he still had to do.

“Ugh, this is going to take me all day!” Natsu complained as he ran his fingers through his hair. “I can’t believe I’m being punished for breaking one little table. It’s not like it’s the first time either…I wonder if I can sneak out the back.” Before Natsu could think about this a little more he heard someone enter the storage room. He turned around to set eyes upon Romeo again, who looked good for someone who had just been sent flying into a table. The swelling in his cheek had also all but vanished; this was most likely Wendy’s doing. What Natsu noticed the most, however, was the strange ball of gray flames in the boy’s palm. “Hey, Romeo, what are you doing here? Don’t tell me you’re angry about the beating I gave you…or do you want a rematch already?” Natsu chuckled and crackled his knuckles; he was always raring to go.

“H-Huh? Oh, no! I came to…reward you for defeating me.” Romeo offered the gray fireball to Natsu. “This is a really special flame I made just for you, big bro! It’s meant for you too eat; it tastes really sweet!” Romeo explained, mentally chuckling in his mind. If his father was right, this flame would drastically weaken Natsu both in strength and magical power once it was consumed. Then he would have a much better chance at defeating him!

“Really? Heh, you didn’t have to do this, Romeo. Beating you wasn’t that much trouble…” replied Natsu as he transferred the gray flame from Romeo’s hand to his own. He was a little suspicious of the flame, but a quick sniff revealed it didn’t stink to high heavens like his Yellow Fire, which was enough for Natsu to assume it was safe. “Oh well, itadakimasu!” Natsu opened his maw and sucked in the gray flame. Romeo watched Natsu’s cheeks fill up before he “chewed” the flame and swallowed. “Hey, what’s the big idea? That didn’t taste sweet at all! If anything it makes me feel kind of funny…”

“Hehe, success!” shouted the younger male before moving into a battle stance. “Now it’s time for some payback, big bro!” Romeo grinned and lit both of fists up with purplish flames. Natsu just raised an eyebrow and watched Romeo punch him in the gut once again…

…which, once again, didn’t make the Dragon Slayer budge an inch. Romeo instantly backed up and rubbed his sore knuckles. “I-I don’t understand! That should of hurt you!”

“Huh?” Natsu looked at Romeo with a confused stare before quickly grinning at him. “Oh I see…that flame was supposed to cripple me somehow, right? Haha, looks like I need to teach you there’s only one kind of flame that matters!” Natsu clenched his own fist, which burst into a raging flame. Romeo’s face went pale as he watched the older Fairy Tail mage rear his fist back again. He squeezed his eyes shut and prepared himself for the pain…

It took several seconds for Romeo to realize something was off. He hadn’t been punched through the door yet and he couldn’t even sense Natsu’s presence in front of him anymore. Sure enough, Romeo opened his eyes to see that Natsu was gone. He glanced around to make sure he wasn’t planning a sneak attack, but the Dragon Slayer was no where to be seen.

“W-What the…”

“…hell happened?!” Natsu exclaimed as he craned his neck all the way back just to look at Romeo’s face far, far above him. Just seconds ago the weaker flame mage had only stood below his chest, but now he towered over him like some kind of young god! Judging by the boy’s titanic, brown boot directly in front of him, Natsu guessed he wasn’t even an inch in comparison to the giant of a kid. He was mere millimeters! “Hey! Hey, Romeo! What the hell did you do to me?!” Natsu screamed up at the junior guild member, but Romeo wasn’t even looking down at him. In fact, the boy seemed just as confused as he was. It would seem Romeo hadn’t planned on this happening, but that didn’t quell Natsu’s rage in the slightest. Needless to say, the mighty Salamander was NOT happy about being shrunken to the size of a mere speck.
141.title: The Tiny Salamander

choices: Romeo sticks around in the guild.
1411.content:
“Romeo! Look at me when I’m talking to you!” Natsu shouted up at the titan of a boy; clearly pissed off as he waved his fists up at the young teen and blew fire from his mouth. Like before, Romeo gave no indication he noticed Natsu’s efforts in the slightest. The Dragon Slayer’s voice simply couldn’t reach his ears so high above. Instead of trying a third time, Natsu moved onto the only other solution he knew: violence. The young fire mage gave his usual battle cry before charging at Romeo’s left boot; both of his fists igniting behind him. Once he reached the brown wall that was Romeo’s foot, he delivered a devastating, explosive punch to it. The strength behind it was enough to take out your average wizard, but the giant didn’t even flinch. While Natsu had barely felt anything from Romeo’s punches, Romeo hadn’t felt a thing from Natsu’s. Getting further agitated, the pink haired Salamander unleashed a barrage of those mighty punches, each one as powerful as the last. When mere punches didn’t seem to have any effect, Natsu resorted to more powerful attacks…

“Fire Dragon’s Claw!”

“Fire Dragon’s Iron Fist!”

“Fire Dragon’s Wing Attack!”

Natsu preformed three of his signature moves in quick secession before stepping back for a breather. Even after all of those powerful blows, the towering Romeo still saw no reason to look down. In addition, the fiery attacks had barely made a scorch mark on the front of the boy’s boot.

“Damn you, Romeo!” Natsu cursed, gritting his sharp teeth. “If attacking from here is useless, then…” The Dragon Slayer once again charged at the boot, but this time he leaped up mid-run. Even with his superhuman jumping capabilities, Natsu wouldn’t be able to reach the top of Romeo’s boot with them alone. The boy’s foot was just too massive in size. To make up for the distance, Natsu used his fire magic and create thrusters on the bottom of his feet that rocketed him up further. With this he easily made it to the top of the boot where he landed with an “oof”

“Success!” Natsu exclaimed, but his victory was short lived as he was suddenly knocked off his feet. Romeo had decided he had enough of standing around in an empty room and started making his way out. Natsu laid on his stomach and gripped onto the rough material of Romero’s boot with both hands. What was simple walking on Romeo’s part was like the moving of Earthland on Natsu’s. If he didn’t hold on he would probably roll off from the boy’s constant motion.

“Grrrr! Stand still so I can hit you some more!” Natsu shouted in frustration as he raised a flaming fist above his head. Before he could slam it down, however, something came over the rosy haired teen. His gut felt like it was doing the tango and his face suddenly turned a sickish green. The hand instead covered Natsu’s mouth as he groaned horribly. “N-No way…I’m being carried on top of his boot. This is…transportation!” Natsu gripped onto the top of the boot with both hands as he buried his sickly face into the slightly musky material of Romeo’s footwear. His cheeks seemed to inflate like balloons and he could feel the need to puke coming on. He was completely helpless.
1411.title: Fire Dragon's Useless Attempts

choices: Romeo picks up a dumbbell or two.
14111.content:
“Romeo, where are you off to?” Macao asked his son as the boy started heading out the guild’s front entrance. He looked pretty down, which surprised the blue haired elder. Had that flame he’d given Romeo not worked?

“I’m just gonna head home for a bit.” Romeo answered his father without turning to look at him. After being humiliated by Natsu in in front of the whole guild and possibly allowing him to escape his punishment, Romeo decided it may be wise to take some time away from the guild. As the spiky haired wizard made his way down the dirt path to Magnolia Town, he was oblivious to the pint-sized passenger that clung to his boot. Natsu was watching through sickly eyes as the world around him sped by as Romeo walked. The giant teenager was going at a normal pace, but Natsu felt like he was moving faster than ever before. The booming quakes that came with each footstep rang in Natsu’s ears and shook his very being. The shrunken Salamander felt the contents of his stomach toss around like a blender and his face turned a darker green.

“Ughhh, I’m gonna hurl!” Natsu exclaimed as he gripped onto the boot’s material harder and forced his face into the brownish footwear.

~~~~

Sometime later, Romeo arrived inside his bedroom. The young fire mage stood in front of his door with is hands on his hips and sighed.

“I feel like shit.” Romeo said to himself as he scratched he back of his neck. He had made such a fool of himself in front of Natsu not once, but twice. The older mage probably thought he was nothing but a nuisance now. He just wanted to collapse on his bed and sleep. As Romeo made his way toward his bed, the mini-Natsu on his boot had reached his limit. He was just too weak to hang on anymore. When next the giant kid lifted his foot to take a step; Natsu’s tiny form slid off the brown boot and fell to the wooden floor below. It was a long drop and any normal person would have been a broken mess upon landing, but Natsu was thankfully much more durable and got away with only a few bruises. Moments after his body hit the floor, Romeo’s massive foot followed and slammed down nearby. The loud thoom so close to Natsu rendered the smaller male temporarily deaf and he covered his ears in pain. A few more thooms later and Romeo was on the other side of the room.

“Ow…well, that wasn’t so bad,” Natsu said to himself as he sat up and rubbed his throbbing head. Now that he was no longer on Romeo, he was starting to feel a lot better. “I only vomited five times!” The rosy haired male got to his feet and took a glance around Romeo’s room. It looked like the room of your average young boy, but many posters of Fairy Tail decorated the walls. There were even a few of him. When Natsu turned back to Romeo, he saw the younger boy standing by his bed. Despite only taking a few steps away from Natsu, the titan seemed to be miles away now!

“Hmmm…ya know, there’s nothing like some healthy exercise to beat depression!” Romeo exclaimed to himself, grinning and pumping his fists into the air. Natsu watched from the floor below as the giant boy began untying his orange scarf and light-colored sash. When both were folded on the ground nearby Romeo slipped off his long jacket; leaving him in just his brown boots and green pants. Natsu was still shocked to see how much Romeo had grown in his seven-year absence. No longer was he the scrawny kid he used to know; he was now very fit for his age. The training the boy put himself through to obtain his current physique must have been hard on him.

“What am I doing?!” Natsu asked himself as he slapped his cheeks. This was no time to be admiring Romeo’s progress; he had to get the boy’s attention and get back to normal! Plus, he still hadn’t forgiven the brat for putting him in this jam in the first place! As the angry, fully recovered, Dragon Slayer dashed toward the bare chested behemoth, Romeo began his exercising…
14111.title: Difference of Opinion

141111.content:
As Natsu ran across the seemingly endless landscape of Romeo’s room he heard a series of booms in the distance. The young titan was lowering himself to the floor and getting into a prone position. Once ready, Romeo started to do push ups; raising and lowering his fit body off the floor at a quick pace. Natsu didn’t think much of this at first; he was too busy trying to reach the giant before he moved again. Natsu ran as fast as he could (which was pretty darn fast), but Romeo seemed to remain miles away no matter the distance he covered.

“Gaaaarrhh!! This sucks!” Natsu growled in frustration as he pumped his leg muscles as much as he could. He hated being so small; so insignificant and weak. The Dragon Slayer continued to roar in anger and frustration the entire time he ran. By the time Natsu finally reached the mountainous boy he was already past three hundred push-ups. His body was just now starting to sweat; salty dew forming on his face and torso. He wasn’t the only one sweating; Natsu was forced to take a breather after running what seemed like the length of a couple cities. “F-Finally made it.” Natsu mumbled as he wiped off his sweating face and looked up at the godly mage before him. “Alright…this is good. With his torso so close like this I have a better shot at getting his attention.” The flame mage grinned toothily and lit one of his fists ablaze. “Get ready to really feel the burn, Romeo!” Natsu exclaimed as he ran directly underneath the exercising behemoth. While the heaving chest of the titan came close to the floor each time he lowered; it didn’t touch it and thus allowed plenty of room for the minuscule Natsu to move around.

Once he was underneath Romeo’s midsection Natsu got to work. The rosy haired mage formed a large fireball in his hand and threw it up at the giant. The tiny speck of fire slightly illuminated the shadowed space under Romeo…but that’s all it did. Natsu’s flames never made it to Romeo’s skin; the fireball was extinguished via the thin layer of sweat that had formed across his body. Natsu wasn’t aware of this, however, and lobbed a few more at random places. Each one was as ineffective as the last; snuffed out by the younger boy’s perspiration. Natsu’s aggravation grew with each failed attempt, but he refused to give up. As Natsu tossed fireball after fireball at Romeo’s abs and pectorals, Romeo was unintentionally fighting back. As the boy reached four hundred push-ups his body sweated ever more; droplets of that sweat fell from his skin and hit the wooden floor below. To Natsu these mere drops of fluid were like bombs; exploding on impact and splashing the area with a hot wetness. Natsu leaped to dodge these explosions; but a few times he wasn’t quick enough and got doused. Soon Natsu’s pink hair had turned damp and flat and his clothes were so soaked they clung to his own muscled torso.

“I’ve had it!” cried Natsu as he got to his feet after being drenched in another helping of Romeo’s fragrant body fluid. The shrunken wizard glared up at Romeo’s torso and clenched his fists. “Fire Dragon’s…” Natsu’s cheeks started to inflate as he filled them with fire. He pointed his mouth straight up and then…”ROAR!!” Natsu opened his maw and released a massive beam of scorching flames into the air. In actuality; the beam was terribly thin compared to Romeo’s size, but it was still powerful enough to make it past the teen’s “barrier” of sweat. As powerful as the attack was, however, it left not but a mark on Romeo’s young figure. The only reaction the titan had was a quick scratch to the area Natsu had hit; Romeo hadn’t even paused in his exercising. Once again Natsu roared in anger as he fell to his knees and slammed his fists against the hard floor. “Nothing’s working! None of my attacks even register with him!” The older teen knew he had even stronger spells in his arsenal, but the truth of the matter was he was low on magical power. He didn’t want to admit it, but perhaps the best thing to do now was find a place to hide and wait for…

Natsu’s thoughts were interrupted by a strange sound in the air. The tiny wizard gazed up at Romeo’s face and noticed the young teenager was breathing much louder. His push-ups were also getting significantly slower. At that precise moment Natsu’s eyes widened in horror and he finally realized the danger he was in at this puny size.

“Oh crap! Crap crap crap!!” Natsu, completely forgetting his fatigue, stood up and raced in a random direction. He needed to get out of the shadow Romeo was casting NOW. Unfortunately, the Fire Dragon Slayer was much too late. He simply wasn’t covering enough ground no matter how hard he pushed himself. The humongous Romeo lifted himself off the ground one more time before reaching his limit. His toned arms stopped supporting him and he let his body collapse to the ground. Natsu, no where near safety, looked up just in time to see Romeo’s _____ falling upon him.
141111.title: Fire Vs. Sweat

1411111.content:
It all happened in a millisecond, but for Natsu it was much longer. One moment Romeo’s chest hanged above him at a safe distance, the next it was descending upon him without mercy. It was like an entire mountain was being dropped on him; a living, breathing mountain of youthful muscle. As the area around Natsu darkened all he could see was the smooth, perfect skin of Romeo’s chest and the moisture that leaked from the countless pores. He could smell the younger male’s B.O. all around him. He could feel the body heat of the mage as he closed in.

“Ro-” Natsu attempted to say something, but barely had time to utter the first syllable of Romeo’s name. The wall of muscle that was one of Romeo’s pecs touched Natsu’s lips…and that was the last thing he tasted. Romeo’s form hit the floor with all of its heavy power and the Dragon Slayer known as Natsu Dragneel simply popped. Romeo felt nothing out of the ordinary; did not feel the body of his hero get obliterated underneath him. For a minute Romeo just laid on the floor; panting for air and resting with a smile on his boyish face. Eventually he picked himself off the ground, but only wobbled backwards before collapsing onto his bed. The black haired fire mage laid there with his arms laced behind his head; his sweaty, chiseled chest lifting and falling with each big breath. Soon he started to calm down and is eyelids closed; welcoming sleep…

“Wait a second!” Romeo’s eyes flew open without warning and his face displayed an expression of annoyance. “I’ll never get as big and strong as big bro if I just rest all the time!” With that said, the young Conbolt ignored his screaming muscles and instantly started on some sit-ups. His body ached and begged for rest, but Romeo would have none of that. He wanted to get stronger and stronger until he could prove to Natsu he was a capable wizard! As the boy worked his abdominals, his body sweated even more from the workout. One of the many droplets of perspiration that decorated his left pec slid over a tiny red dot; effectively washing it away. Any evidence of the mighty Salamander had now disappeared without a trace.
1411111.title: Dropped a Kid on Him

142.content:
Natsu Dragneel walked into his house with a big, toothily grin on his face. The Fire Dragon Slayer was just coming from the Fairy Tail Building after getting into another fight with his rival, Gray Fullbuster. This fight, however, had a very satisfying conclusion. Whether it was a lucky shot or the ice mage was having a bad day, Natsu had succeeded in delivering a devastating uppercut that launched Gray into the ceiling of the building. The smug Natsu then walked out; leaving Gray with his head stuck in the roof and the rest of the guild laughing hysterically.

“Heh, that perverted stripper deserved it!” Natsu said to himself as he slammed his fist into his palm. “After a victory like that I think I deserve some relaxation! The rosy haired teen walked away from his front door and was about slump onto one of the nearby couches when he heard a pounding on his door. Startled, Natsu looked back at the wooden door as someone banged on it again. “Geez, who could that be? Can’t a Dragon Slayer just relax?” Natsu grumbled as he made his way back to the door and opened it while saying, “Yeah? What do you-?” However, he could not finish the sentence, seeing as it’s quite difficult to speak when an ice-coated fist is buried into your mouth. The blow sent Natsu flying backwards; his body soaring over his rectangular table and landing with a “thump” on one of the sofas.
